page.title: 09SIKH COMMUNITY CENTRE.
page.content: There are approximately 6 000 Asians in Leamington Spa, of whom 90% are Sikhs. The Sikh community has a newly-built temple in New Street, and has recently bought a large Church Hall nearby. Renovations cost Â£200 000 and the centre now contains two large halls, a stage, a kitchen, a meeting room, a classroom and an office. The centre, which is run by a committee, holds a variety of activities for the Sikhs including a day centre for old people where social activities are held and meals provided. Classes in Bhangra dancing and Indian music are held. Punjabi language classes for young people held every weekday evening are particularly important and free of charge.Although used primarily by the Asian community it is open to everyone.
